conclusion: Points A, B, and C are vertices of an equilateral triangle with charges at A and B.
Electric field at center O due to charges at A and B is zero because their fields cancel out.
Electric field at center O due to charge at C is zero because it cancels with fields from A and B.
Total electric field at center O is zero.
Electric potential at center O is zero since electric field is zero and potential at infinity is 0.
Magnitude of electric-field strength and electric potential at point O are both 0.
